name: Missing Pieces
title: Missing Pieces
summary: A tribute to lost loved ones, for Claire...

name: The Artistic Interpretation of Software
title: The Artistic Interpretation of Software
summary: I recently watch a television program that talked about how humanity is the only species on our planet that creates art.  The thing with art, is that the more you look for it, the more of it you see.

name: Navigating to the New World
title: Navigating to the New World
summary: A look at the roots of navigation within our applications, where it's going and the UX implications

name: Lessons learnt from Google Inbox
title: Lessons learnt from Google Inbox
summary: Inbox by Gmail may be on the verge of being discontinued, but it teaches us a lot about product design, this article takes a look at the lessons it taught us.

name: Grief-inspired design
title: Grief-inspired design
summary: Product design doesn't have anything in common with processing intense grief. Does it? Sometimes we have to be forced into taking a step back in order to see the obvious.

name: Getting started with HTML email
title: Getting started with HTML email
summary: An examination of the basics of professional looking HTML based email

name: HTML Email Editors: A Design Case Study
title: HTML Email Editors: A Design Case Study
summary: We all know of applications that allow experienced users to produce stunning responsive emails. However, it's rare to come across an HTML email editor that appeals to users with all experience levels, this article examines how to get the best of both worlds

name: Deep Breaths
title: Deep Breaths
summary: Poetry, tale of our trip to the coroners court.

name: Database Manager: Simplifying Database Upgrades
title: Database Manager: Simplifying Database Upgrades
summary:
Database upgrade processes for corporate products can end up taking on a life of their own as each upgrade adds to the plethora of upgrade scripts. With older products this means that the upgrade process is so complex that the upgrade process itself may as well be considered a separate product in its own right.

When in Rome...

name: Securing User Logins with MVC and JWT
title: Securing User Logins with MVC and JWT
summary: Ensuring that an MVC application is fully secured can feel daunting. At first glance, the most important part of the login process is the login screen itself, and yes this is the natural starting point, but it's only the beginning.

name: Updating the Collation of an Existing MSSQL Database
title: Updating the Collation of an Existing MSSQL Database
summary: Changing a database collation doesn't need to be something we avoid at all costs.

name: Reusable MVC Razor Components with HTML Extension Methods
title: Reusable MVC Razor Components with HTML Extension Methods
summary: Component reuse an intrinsic feature of modern JavaScript frameworks. React, Angular & Vue guide us toward creating small, reusable components.  MVC Razor isn't as intuitive, but it's still possible to create something which is easy to use and maintain.
